revised_title: Observations on Boiling Fountains and Subterranean Steams
tldr: The author, Dr. Tancred Robinson, investigates boiling fountains and subterranean steams, observing their various temperatures and effects on surrounding environments. He discusses the potential causes of these phenomena, including the role of sulfur and the sublimation of pyrites, and reflects on the vast variety of underground effluvia and their effects on the surface.
